executive_summary: Boutique hotels focus on providing luxury accommodations with an emphasis on design, individualization and quality of service. Industry revenue dropped in 2020 due to the negative effects of the pandemic. However, a dramatic surge in travel following easing lockdown mandates in the latter part of the current period has driven the industry's growth. Over the past five years, revenue has grown at a CAGR of 7.7% to $34.8 billion, including an expected 4.5% boost in 2024. Profit is expected to slump to 16.6% of revenue in 2024 from 17.5% in 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Experienced a Sharp Decline in Demand During COVID-19
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Boutique hotels, which have tighter profit margins and don't benefit from the same economies of scale that large hotels can leverage, suffered greatly as consumers were encouraged to remain at home and avoid unnecessary travel to slow the spread of the virus.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Boutique Experience and Technology Drive Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Boutique hotels have captured a record-level demand for travel, leading to industry revenue recovery. The industry includes intimate, upscale hotels that feature unique architecture and design. Boutique hotels are often categorized as independent, lifestyle or soft brands, depending on brand affiliation and design focus.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Profit Tends to be Tighter for Boutique Hotels Compared with Larger Hotels
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Boutique hotels can often be built or renovated for a fraction of the price of building a new luxury hotel. Boutique hotels are typically smaller and have fewer rooms, generally between 10 and 250. They can also exclude some features and services, such as larger rooms and extensive lobbies and replace them with inexpensive adornments.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Number of Business Guests at Boutique Hotels Will Accelerate
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Boutique hotels will capture the return of business travel demand, which will increase moving forward. Though many businesses will continue to meet remotely moving forward, business spending will still swell as corporate profit grows.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased Inflation and the Potential for an Economic Downturn Threaten the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite recession concerns, industry revenue will be sustained by consumer spending growth and steady interest in unique vacations and traveling. The industry will significantly benefit from increased inbound trips made by non-US residents. Travel spending will climb over the next five years due to higher demand for domestic and international travel as the travel sector emerges from the pandemic.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Investment in New Boutique Hotels Will Accelerate Due to a Rise in Accommodation Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As inflation remains a concern, credit environments will become increasingly more challenging, causing pauses and delays for many hotel acquisitions. Besides, room oversupply and competing forms of accommodation in some geographic regions still threaten growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Boutique Hotels Capitalize on the Demand for Unique Accommodation Experiences
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: This advantage may only be sustainable over the short-term as targeted hotels catering to new and diverse experiences proliferate. As the market saturates and the novelty of boutique hotels diminishes, boutique hotels may be forced to rethink their services and experiences. This shift may result in a dramatic hike in capital costs associated with running these hotels.

industry_definition: This industry includes intimate, luxurious and upscale hotel environments that feature unique architecture and design. Industry establishments are also known as lifestyle hotels, villas and wellness hotels. They may offer food and beverage services and have restaurants, spas and salons on their premises. This industry doesn't include chain hotels, though it does include soft brands affiliated with larger hotel groups.
key_trends: - Extra services can make a boutique hotel stand out. Offering a unique experience creates a lure to the hotel, allowing it to grow in popularity.

- New accommodation options keep rising. Hotels have been competing against camping sites, bed and breakfasts and hostels, which are more affordable options. New services, such as Airbnb and VRBO, continue to grow in popularity as an alternative to traditional accommodation facilities.

- Increased travel demand and consumer preference for unique accommodations focused on style and individualization fueled strong growth within the industry. However, the pandemic halted domestic and international travel, significantly affecting demand.

- Many new boutique hotels will open over the next five years, especially in destination cities such as New York and San Francisco. But expansion in the number of boutique hotels will put pressure on industry profit.
- Large hotels have an online presence and can showcase their amenities, services, rooms and other features online.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the seasonality of cash flow?
